title: Stack overflow exception after updating beacon node to version 1.4.2
body:
# üêû Bug Report
Stack overflow exception after updating beacon node to version 1.4.2

### Description
After updating beacon node to version 1.4.2 it throws a stack overflow exception after some period of work.

### Has this worked before in a previous version?
Yes

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
Run beacon node via docker.

```
sudo docker run -t -d -v $HOME/.eth2:/data \
--name beacon-node \
-p 3500:3500 -p 4000:4000 -p 13000:13000 -p 12000:12000/udp \
gcr.io/prysmaticlabs/prysm/beacon-chain:stable \
--datadir=/data \
--rpc-host=0.0.0.0 \
--grpc-gateway-host=0.0.0.0 \
--grpc-gateway-corsdomain=http://0.0.0.0:7500,http://127.0.0.1:7500,http://localhost:7500 \
--http-web3provider=https://mainnet.infura.io/v3/... \
--accept-terms-of-use --enable-next-slot-state-cache
```
## üî• Error

Full log [https://pastebin.com/t8y23a6C](https://pastebin.com/t8y23a6C)

Top of the log
<pre><code>
[2021-07-29 01:07:48]  INFO blockchain: Finished applying state transition attestations=128
[2021-07-29 01:07:59]  INFO blockchain: Synced new block block=0xcbe5113f... epoch=53898 finalizedEpoch=53896 finalizedRoot=0x960d9bc8... slot=1724738 slotInEpoch=2
[2021-07-29 01:07:59]  INFO blockchain: Finished applying state transition attestations=121
[2021-07-29 01:08:11]  INFO blockchain: Synced new block block=0xd52d7b36... epoch=53898 finalizedEpoch=53896 finalizedRoot=0x960d9bc8... slot=1724739 slotInEpoch=3
[2021-07-29 01:08:11]  INFO blockchain: Finished applying state transition attestations=49
runtime: goroutine stack exceeds 1000000000-byte limit
runtime: sp=0xc0da658340 stack=[0xc0da658000, 0xc0fa658000]
fatal error: stack overflow

runtime.newstack()

runtime.morestack()

@nazar-kuzo  Maybe this would help [post](https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/issues/9267#issuecomment-886185185) as a work around.

@ahadda5 thanks for reaching out, not sure whether this workaround is relevant since I run beacon-node and validator on the same machine and I have already blocked incoming requests over 4000 port. I assume that exception stack should shed some light to the real issue

If I'm reading this right, in [method `(*Gateway).Start` in file _shared/gateway/gateway.go_](https://sourcegraph.com/github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm@a9ee3ee06afdffa2a9b0e759d4142642e7488416/-/blob/shared/gateway/gateway.go?L107-L155), we [set up the CORS middleware to wrap the `Gateway`'s multiplexer](https://sourcegraph.com/github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm@a9ee3ee06afdffa2a9b0e759d4142642e7488416/-/blob/shared/gateway/gateway.go?L133-L136). We then tell the `Gateway`'s multiplexer to [send all requests through to the `Gateway`'s handler](https://sourcegraph.com/github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm@a9ee3ee06afdffa2a9b0e759d4142642e7488416/-/blob/shared/gateway/gateway.go?L134), which in turn [calls on the supplied handler](https://sourcegraph.com/github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm@master/-/blob/beacon-chain/gateway/helpers.go?L68-L70), which [is that same CORS middleware](https://sourcegraph.com/github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm@a9ee3ee06afdffa2a9b0e759d4142642e7488416/-/blob/shared/gateway/gateway.go?L135).

Thus we have:
- [`Gateway.mux`](https://sourcegraph.com/github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm@a9ee3ee06afdffa2a9b0e759d4142642e7488416/-/blob/shared/gateway/gateway.go?L134) ‚Üí
- [`muxHandler`](https://sourcegraph.com/github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm@master/-/blob/beacon-chain/gateway/helpers.go?L68-L70) ‚Üí
- [`corsMux`](https://sourcegraph.com/github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm@a9ee3ee06afdffa2a9b0e759d4142642e7488416/-/blob/shared/gateway/gateway.go?L133) ‚Üí
- Eventually [get around to calling on](https://sourcegraph.com/github.com/rs/cors/-/blob/cors.go?L212-L219) ‚Üí
- `Gateway.mux` ‚Üí
_[...]_
@seh ,you are absolutely right. Fix for the problem: https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/pull/9264
